properties.areaDesc: Eastern Mojave Desert, Including the Mojave National Preserve; Morongo Basin; Northwest Plateau; Owens Valley; Southern Clark County; Esmeralda and Central Nye County; Las Vegas Valley; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon; Lake Mead National Recreation Area; White Mountains of Inyo County; Lincoln County; Western Clark and Southern Nye County; Death Valley National Park; Northwest Deserts; Lake Mead National Recreation Area; Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Western Mojave Desert; Northeast Clark County; Sheep Range
properties.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 1 at 2:07PM PST until February 3 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Las Vegas NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Southwest to west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60
mph will develop late Sunday afternoon ahead of a fast moving
powerful cold front. Northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up
to 70 mph will spread down across the region behind the front
Sunday evening and Sunday night.

* WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona, southeast California
and south central and southern Nevada.

* WHEN...From 4 PM PST /5 PM MST/ Sunday to 6 PM PST /7 PM MST/
Monday.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines
leading to power outages. Travel will be hazardous, especially
for high profile vehicles.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest speeds are expected late Sunday
evening and overnight Sunday night as the cold front passes.
Speeds will decrease slightly early Monday morning but
widespread gusts over 40 mph will continue Monday.
properties.instruction:
Take action to secure trash cans...lawn furniture...and other
loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Motorcycle riders and
drivers of vans...campers...trailers and any other high profile
vehicle should be alert to the danger of these high winds. Boaters
should postpone plans to venture out on Lake Mead and Lake Mohave
or stay in well protected areas.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM PST /5 PM MST/ SUNDAY TO 6 PM PST /7 PM MST/ MONDAY
